<<<<<<< HEAD
The mischiefe and miserie of scandals both taken, and giuen. By Ier. Dyke, minister of Epping in Essex Dyke, Jeremiah, 1584-1639.
[28], 192, 191-242 p.
Printed by W[illiam] S[tansby] for R. Milbourne, in Pauls Church-yard at the Grey-hound, London : 1631.
Printer's name from STC. Cf. Folger catalogue, which gives signatures: [par.] A⁴ [chi]² B-Q R² . Running title reads: The mischiefe of scandals. Variant: imprint has "Milborne". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
The mischiefe and miserie of scandals both taken, and giuen. By Ier. Dyke, minister of Epping in Essex Dyke, Jeremiah, 1584-1639.
[28], 192, 191-242 p.
Printed by W[illiam] S[tansby] for R. Milbourne, in Pauls Church-yard at the Grey-hound, London : 1631.
Printer's name from STC. Cf. Folger catalogue, which gives signatures: [par.] A⁴ [chi]² B-Q R² . Running title reads: The mischiefe of scandals. Variant: imprint has "Milborne". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
R. Milbourne
W[illiam] S[tansby]
Pauls Church-yard at the Grey-hound
